summary.para: Represents an address. It is used in the structure.

remarks.para: This structure supersedes the ADDRESS structure. For more information, see Updated Platform Support. ADDRESS is defined as follows in DbgHelp.h.

summary.para: The offset into the segment, or a 32-bit virtual address. The interpretation of this value depends on the value contained in the Mode member.
The segment number. This value is used only for 16-bit addressing.
The addressing mode. This member can be one of the following values.

description.para: 16:16 addressing. To support this addressing mode, you must supply a TranslateAddressProc64 callback function.
16:32 addressing. To support this addressing mode, you must supply a TranslateAddressProc64 callback function.
Real-mode addressing. To support this addressing mode, you must supply a TranslateAddressProc64 callback function.
Flat addressing. This is the only addressing mode supported by the library.
